channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: What we know so far about drone attack on Iran
item.description: Iranian anti-aircraft systems have shot down suspected drones near a military base in Isfahan.

item.title: Israeli raids cause ‘worst destruction in decades’ in Tulkarem
item.description: An Israeli raid on a refugee camp in the occupied West Bank has caused some of the “worst destruction in decades”.

item.title: US, EU impose new sanctions on hardliner Israeli settlers
item.description: The EU slaps sanctions on four 'extremist' settlers and two groups, as US adds one person and two entities to its list.

item.title: India votes in first phase of marathon election as Modi seeks third term
item.description: Polls have closed in the first of seven phases that covered 102 constituencies across 21 states and territories.

item.title: Man detained in France after bomb threat at Iran consulate
item.description: French prosecutors say no explosives found on suspect or at the Iranian consular office in Paris.

item.title: G7 countries slam Chinese firms’ support for Russia’s defence industry
item.description: Ministers say transfer of weapons components is enabling Russia to 'reconstitute and revitalise' its defence production.

item.title: Video captures alleged Ukrainian downing of Russian bomber in Russia
item.description: The Ukrainian military says it shot down a Russian Tu-22M3 long-range bomber over Russian territory. Russia denies this,

item.title: Has Israel attacked Iran’s Isfahan province? What we know so far
item.description: Iran deployed air defence batteries to intercept three drones, but downplayed the incident.

item.title: How is overtourism affecting local communities?
item.description: How overtourism impacts local communities and ecosystems at some of the world's most Instagrammable travel destinations.

item.title: Israeli minister suggests reported attack on Iran was ’feeble’
item.description: Al Jazeera’s Bernard Smith says Israeli officials won’t confirm or deny the country’s involvement in the attack on Iran.

item.title: Ukraine says it shot down Russian strategic bomber after strike kills nine
item.description: Russian officials says the plane crashed over the southern Stavropol region due to a technical malfunction.

item.title: How Iran-Israel tensions have escalated since the war on Gaza: A timeline
item.description: Iranian media on Friday reported explosions in Isfahan city, amid steadily increasing tensions with Israel.

item.title: Russia doesn’t have capability to knock Ukraine out of war: Ex-US commander
item.description: Ben Hodges, who led US forces in Europe, says Western powers should overcome their fears of supporting Ukraine.

item.title: Gaza, genocide and the world’s most heinous crime
item.description: The words of the Jewish lawyer who coined the term 'genocide' still hold lessons for us today.

item.title: Analysis: Why an Israeli attack on Iran’s nuclear facilities is a bad idea
item.description: A direct Israeli attack on Iran's nuclear sites would yield little while risking too much.

item.title: Cass Review: A victory for women, children and common sense
item.description: The review into gender care services in England exposed one of the biggest medical negligence scandals in recent times.

item.title: Israel ‘seems determined to drag the region into war’ says analyst
item.description: Middle East analyst Mouin Rabbani says Israel appears intent on "dragging the region into war".

item.title: World urges ‘de-escalation’ after drones shot down over Iran
item.description: Escalation more than six months into Israel’s war on Gaza has raised fears of spiralling violence across region.

item.title: ‘Blatant aggression’: Reactions to US veto of Palestine’s UN membership bid
item.description: The vote in the 15-member Security Council was 12 in favour and two abstentions - the UK and Switzerland.

item.title: ‘Triple spending’: Zimbabweans bear cost of changing to new ZiG currency
item.description: Businesses, transport, government services reject old notes despite the unavailability of new bills until end of month.

item.title: Pakistan attack targets van carrying Japanese autoworkers
item.description: Police said three people were wounded in port city of Karachi but bomber and accomplice died.

item.title: Flashes seen in sky above Iran as drones are ‘shot down’
item.description: Video shows flashes in the night sky above Isfahan in Iran, where state media said three drones were shot down.

item.title: Teenager charged with ‘terrorism’ over Australia church stabbing attack
item.description: Boy was arrested at the scene after Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel was attacked during a service in Sydney.

item.title: Google fires 28 staff after protests against cloud contract with Israel
item.description: Tech giant says employees engaged in 'completely unacceptable behaviour' during sit-in at company offices.

item.title: Can Sunil Kanugolu bring India’s Modi down, 10 years after helping him win?
item.description: As India's election kicks off, a top election strategist is looking for cracks in the Modi brand he helped create.
